page.title: 18Hadley Bowling Green Club
page.content: Hadley Bowling Green, in the heart or rural Worcestershire, is one of the oldest{Crown Greens}in England. It is thought to date back to Roman times, as many{Roman relics}have been dug up in the past. The Bowling Club started in the reign of the first Elizabeth, and the yew hedge which surrounds part of the Green is thought to date back to then. An inn was built adjoining the Green, and{Queen Elizabeth}was staying there just prior to{Sir {Francis Drake's}famous game of bowls on the Hoe at Plymouth on the eve of the Spanish Armada. The Bowling Club meets twelve times a year and have a meal at the Inn.In the{Club House}are all the charts, plaques and pictures that have been collected throughout the long history of the Club. Recently a{Clay Pigeon Shooting Club}has also been started, based at the Inn.
